alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Morris County through 1000 PM CDT... At 915 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dwight, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Council Grove, Dwight, Wilsey, Parkerville, Dunlap and Council Grove Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
